slides.title: Welcome to CA Foundation
slides.content:
# CA Foundation

The **first step** in your Chartered Accountancy journey.

## What You Will Learn

- **Paper 1** - Accounting Principles
- **Paper 2** - Business Laws & BCR
- **Paper 3** - Quantitative Aptitude
- **Paper 4** - Business Economics

## Exam Pattern

| Paper | Marks |
|-------|-------|
| Accounting | 100 |
| Law & BCR | 100 |
| Quantitative | 100 |
| Economics | 100 |

slides.title: Accounting Principles
slides.content:
# Paper 1 - Accounting

## Key Topics

| Topic | Coverage |
|-------|----------|
| Concepts | GAAP, Conventions |
| Journal | Double entry |
| Ledger | Posting |
| Trial Balance | Balancing |
| Final Accounts | P&L, Balance Sheet |

## Accounting Equation

```
Assets = Liabilities + Capital

Or

A = L + C + R - E
```

slides.title: Depreciation and Inventory
slides.content:
# Key Adjustments

## Depreciation Methods

| Method | Pattern |
|--------|--------|
| Straight Line | Equal |
| WDV | Diminishing |

## Formulas

```
SLM = (Cost - Salvage) / Life

WDV = Book Value x Rate
```

## Inventory Valuation

| Method | Cost Flow |
|--------|----------|
| FIFO | First in first out |
| Weighted Average | Average cost |

## Rule

```
Lower of Cost and NRV
```

slides.title: Business Mathematics
slides.content:
# Paper 3A - QA

## Topics

| Topic | Content |
|-------|--------|
| Ratio | Proportion |
| Indices | Powers |
| Logarithms | Calculations |
| Equations | Linear, quadratic |
| Interest | Simple, compound |

## Key Formulas

```
Simple Interest = P x R x T / 100

Compound Interest = P(1 + r)^n - P

Annuity = P x [(1+r)^n - 1] / r
```

slides.title: Statistics
slides.content:
# Statistical Measures

## Central Tendency

| Measure | Use |
|---------|-----|
| Mean | Average |
| Median | Middle |
| Mode | Most frequent |

## Dispersion

| Measure | Formula Concept |
|---------|----------------|
| Range | Max - Min |
| Variance | Average squared deviation |
| SD | Square root of variance |

## Correlation

```
r = -1 to +1
+1 = Perfect positive
-1 = Perfect negative
0 = No correlation
```
